benchmark_details.name: INVESTOR BENCH
benchmark_details.overview: INVESTOR BENCH is a benchmark specifically designed for evaluating LLM-based agents in diverse financial decision-making contexts, providing a comprehensive suite of tasks applicable to financial products including stocks, cryptocurrencies, and exchange-traded funds (ETFs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the reasoning and decision-making capabilities of LLM-based agents in complex financial scenarios.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Currently focusing on single-asset financial decision-making tasks and does not address multi-asset tasks such as portfolio management.

data.source: Utilizes a range of open-source data and incorporates third-party APIs, including Yahoo Finance and SEC EDGAR.
data.size: Various dataset sizes depending on financial product (not explicitly stated)
data.annotation: Data collected and curated from multiple sources, including market data and news articles.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of the financial agents in different trading environments.
methodology.interpretation: Higher CR and SR indicate better performance, while AV and MDD measure risk and stability; lower values are preferable.
methodology.baseline_results: Buy & Hold strategy as baseline for performance comparison.
methodology.validation: Evaluation is performed across various financial decision-making tasks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data does not contain personal information and conforms to established ethical guidelines.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data shared under the MIT license.
